data.text: What is the absolute refractory period?
choices: The period when the neuron membrane is at its resting state

The period of increased K⁺ permeability
data.answer: The period when the neuron cannot respond to another stimulus, starting with the opening of Na⁺ channels and ending when they begin to reset

data.answer: Repolarization is occurring, and the neuron is less responsive to additional stimuli

data.text: What is a synapse?

data.text: What is the presynaptic neuron?
choices: The neuron conducting impulses away from the synapse

data.answer: The neuron conducting impulses toward the synapse

data.text: What is the postsynaptic neuron?
choices: The neuron conducting impulses away from the synapse
The neuron transmitting the electrical signal across the synapse
The neuron conducting impulses toward the synapse
data.answer: The neuron transmitting the electrical signal across the synapse

data.answer: Chemical synapses allow direct ion flow between neurons, while electrical synapses rely on neurotransmitters.
